Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Apis (?) bull or cow. Snout only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white (gypsum?) coating. Dark brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This fragment of an Apis Bull is in a naturalistic style. See parallel from Naukratis dated 2nd - 1st century BC (British Museum GR1888,0601.103). Unprovenanced parallels dating from the1st to 2nd centuries AD in Tübingen (Fischer no. 1087), the British Museum (Bailey nos 3719, 20) and the Louvre Roman parallels (Dunand nos 918-920) tend to be simpler and more styalistic. The naturalistic style may suggest an earlier (Ptolemaic) date, or regional differences. Dunand, F. 1990. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte. Paris Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.214) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 97, nos 252-253)
